metadata.value:
Job Title Technical Consultant - Fabric
Reporting To Head of Global Delivery, ANZ
Direct Reports N/A
Job Purpose
The role of the Managed Services (MS) Technical Consultant - Fabric resides in the functional area of Post-sales
services as part of our highly experienced Managed Service team. Specifically the role provides technical and
operational support services across the client’s enterprise storage and Fabric technologies. These platforms
include Hitachi Vantara block, object and file hardware and software products, as well as 3rd Party products
such as VMware, CommVault, and Cisco solutions. This is delivered primarily from the customer site and
various locations as required. The role at times is required to be involved in other non-operational tasks such
as presales and project tasks; including but not limited to pre-requisite checklists, initial installation,
troubleshooting, implementation, customization, integration and “hands on” training of systems and staff that
support Hitachi Vantara Customers.
The Technical Consultant – Fabric works closely with Project Management, Principal Consultants, Service
Delivery Managers and other MS Technical Consultants and the customer to ensure a smooth implementation
and transition from project kick-off through integration/testing/deployment to project close and ongoing
operations and support
For this position at Hitachi Vantara, in-depth knowledge of Cisco Fabric architecture, design and administration
is required as this role will be the lead subject matter expert on backup platforms for the Managed Service.
You will administer, configure, deploy and support effective Fabric solutions. You must be able to identify and
troubleshoot problems in a multi-Fabric SAN environment. An in-depth knowledge of Cisco Fabric and VSAN in
physical and virtualised environments is required.
Responsibilities
• Demonstrated working proficiency in SAN Fabric management (ISLs, utilization, zoning, masking, etc.)
• Manage and administer SAN hardware and software for Cisco Fabric architectures
• Administer hardware components specifically focused on Hitachi, Cisco, and VMware
• Advanced skills: Familiar with all Hitachi storage systems and Commvault backup environments
• Interpret storage protocols including iSCSI, Fiber Channel, CIFS, NFS, NDMP protocols and hardware,
which use these products
• Maintain current knowledge of storage and Fabric related trends and issues including current emerging
technologies and best practices
• Provide capacity planning, performance analysis, disaster recovery planning, and lead efforts towards
Fabric administration and modernisation
• Provide technical expertise, guidance and strategic recommendations to develop a roadmap that
ensures that the current and planned Fabric solutions are compatible with the company's business
needs and strategic objectives
• Develop, implement and oversee policies and procedures to ensure consistent Fabric provisioning,
uptime, and regulatory compliance
• Willingness to manage a 24x7 Fabric, storage, compute and backup environment including on-call
rotation, weekend work, etc
• Extensive experience in design and documentation of Fabric topologies
• Supporting Fabric and storage in a VMware virtualization environment
• Manage and provide current Fabric usage statistics, provide future projected growth estimates
• Ability to plan, document and effectively implement projects and systems
• Demonstrated ability to work in a high volume, fast paced environment with many deadlines and
competing priorities
• Some knowledge and experience desirable with storage, Data Replication, Snap Shots and
Virtualization Technology
• Knowledge of Networking, Routing and Switching Technologies
• Some knowledge desirable of Windows Server Administration
Qualifications:
• 5+ years of customer-facing experience of managing Cisco Fabric hardware and software platforms
• 5+ years performing Fabric capacity planning, performance analysis and development of business
recovery plans including regular testing
• 5+ years with Cisco Fabric software
• Certification or in-depth experience in Cisco Fabric management
• Experience in operating systems administration across UNIX and Windows is desirable
• Experience in virtual platform technology e.g. VMWare is desirable
• Experience and knowledge of IP Networking, Routing and Switching Technologies is desirable
• Good knowledge of ITIL and working within a managed services framework
• Knowledge of Hitachi block and object storage systems is desirable
Competencies
• Demonstrate working proficiency in SAN Fabric management (ISLs, utilization, zoning, masking, etc.)
• Experience with Cisco SAN hardware, software and Fabric architectures
• Able to communicate clearly with peers, as well as management, suppliers and the Customer
• Self-driven and resourceful to achieve goals independently as well as work well in groups
• Flexibility to adjust to changing requirements, schedules and priorities
• The ability to socialise ideas, make recommendations and gather team consensus to move forward
• Excellent communication, writing, meeting facilitation skills
• Ability to be the lead SME for Fabric services within the team and to the Customer

Diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) are integral to our culture and identity. Diverse thinking, a commitment to allyship, and a culture of empowerment help us achieve powerful results. We want you to be you, with all the ideas, lived experience, and fresh perspective that brings. We support your uniqueness and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our team.
How we look after you
We want to help you take care of your today and tomorrow – at home and at work. Which is why we offer industry-leading benefits that go far beyond compensation. That means support, services, and resources that also take care of your holistic health and wellbeing. We’re always looking for new ways of working that bring out our best, which leads to unexpected ideas. Here, you’ll experience a sense of belonging, and discover autonomy, freedom, and ownership as you work alongside talented people you enjoy sharing knowledge with. We’re also champions of life balance and offer flexible arrangements that work for you (role and location dependent).
About us
We’re a global team of innovators. Together, we harness engineering excellence and passion for insight to co-create meaningful solutions to complex challenges. We turn organizations into data-driven leaders that can a make positive impact on their industries and society. If you believe that innovation can inspire the future, this is the place to fulfil your purpose and achieve your potential.
We’re proud to say we’re an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, age, disability status or any other protected characteristic. Should you need reasonable accommodations during the recruitment process, please let us know so that we can do our best to set you up for success.

demographic_questions.description:
At Hitachi Vantara, we value the diversity of our workforce and strive to foster an inclusive environment in which talent from all backgrounds can thrive, bringing their unique contributions to our culture and success. We are an equal opportunity employer and seek to strengthen our hiring practices by identifying and mitigating the potential for bias in our assessment and selection processes.

Below is a set of voluntary demographic questions that, if you choose to complete, will provide aggregated data to inform our hiring strategy and help us uphold our commitment to inclusive hiring.  Your responses, or choice to not respond, will in no way be linked to your specific application and will not be used to inform the hiring decision.

Our company does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression or veteran status. In order to track the effectiveness of our recruiting efforts and ensure we consider the needs of all our employees, please consider the following optional questions.
